reference.notes:
Elements References -------- ---------- H Li Be B C N O F Ne Na Mg Al Si P S Cl Ar K Ca: .
H, Li - Ne: R. Krishnan, J.S. Binkley, R. Seeger and J.A. Pople, J. Chem. Phys. 72, 650 (1980) Na - Ar: A.D. McLean and G.S. Chandler J. Chem. Phys. 72, 5639, (1980). K - Ca: J-P. Blaudeau, M. P. McGrath, L.A. Curtiss and L. Radom, J. Chem. Phys. 107, 5016 (1997).
6-311G* Polarization Functions ------------------------------- Elements Reference H - He: (1p) R. Krishnan, J.S. Binkley, R. Seeger and J.A. Pople, J. Chem. Li - Ne: (1d) Phys. 72, 650 (1980). Note: This basis uses 5-component d functions. This collection of polarization functions was chosen to give the lowest possible energy for the atomic ground states in frozen core UMP2 calculations. For Be all exponents were optimized for the 1s2 2s1 2p1 excited 2-P state.
Diffuse functions: H, Li-Cl: T. Clark, J. Chandrasekhar, G.W. Spitznagel, P.V.R. Schleyer, J. Comp. Chem. 4, 294 (1983).
